info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 4:56PM CDT until June 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following counties, Merrick and Nance.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly small creeks and rural roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 453 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving through the area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have already fallen or will yet fall in much of the Advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Additional rainfall up to around 1 inch is possible over the next few hours, with additional higher totals possible overnight. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Warm Slough, Moores Creek, Silver Creek, Prairie Slough and Prairie Creek. - Some locations that could will experience flooding include... Central City, Clarks, Silver Creek, Chapman and Archer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING
